org.jointheleague.erik.irobot

Class SerialConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jointheleague.erik.irobot.SerialConnection

  • public final class SerialConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the communication channel between the IOIO board and the iRobot. At most one instance of this class may be instantiated. Use the getInsatnce(IOIO ioio, boolean debug) method to get that instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the serial connection
      static SerialConnection getInstance(ioio.lib.api.IOIO ioio, boolean debug)
      Gets a default serial connection to the iRobot.
      int getMaxCommandSize()
      The maximum number of bytes that can be transmitted in a command to the iRobot
      int readSignedByte()
      Reads a byte received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets it as a signed byte, i.e., value is in the range -128 - 127.
      int readSignedWord()
      Reads 2 bytes received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets them as a signed word, i.e., value is in range -32768 - 32767.
      int readUnsignedByte()
      Reads a byte received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets it as an unsigned byte, i.e., value is in range 0 - 255.
      int readUnsignedBytes(int[] buffer, int start, int length)
      Reads several bytes received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets each as an unsigned byte, i.e., each value is in the range 0 - 255.
      int readUnsignedWord()
      Reads 2 bytes received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets them as an unsigned word, i.e., value is in range 0 - 65535.
      void setDebug(boolean debug)
      Sets the debugging mode
      void writeByte(int b)
      Sends a byte over the serial connection to the iRobot.
      void writeBytes(byte[] bytes, int start, int length)
      Sends several bytes over the serial connection to the iRobot
      void writeBytes(int[] ints, int start, int length)
      Sends several bytes over the serial connection to the iRobot
      void writeSignedWord(int value)
      Sends a signed word to the iRobot over the serial connection as two bytes, high byte first.
      void writeUnsignedWord(int value)
      Sends an unsigned word to the iRobot over the serial connection as two bytes, high byte first.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SerialConnection getInstance(ioio.lib.api.IOIO ioio,
                                           boolean debug)
                                    throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Gets a default serial connection to the iRobot. This method returns after a connection between the IOIO and the iRobot has been established.
        Parameters:
        ioio - the ioio instance used to connect to the iRobot
        debug - if true establishes a connection that prints out debugging information.
        Returns:
        a serial connection to the iRobot
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • getMaxCommandSize

        public int getMaxCommandSize()
        The maximum number of bytes that can be transmitted in a command to the iRobot
        Returns:
        the max size in bytes

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean debug)
        Sets the debugging mode
        Parameters:
        debug - if true generates printouts to Log.

      • readSignedByte

        public int readSignedByte()
                   throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Reads a byte received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets it as a signed byte, i.e., value is in the range -128 - 127.
        Returns:
        the value as an int
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • readUnsignedByte

        public int readUnsignedByte()
                     throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Reads a byte received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets it as an unsigned byte, i.e., value is in range 0 - 255.
        Returns:
        the value as an int
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • readSignedWord

        public int readSignedWord()
                   throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Reads 2 bytes received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets them as a signed word, i.e., value is in range -32768 - 32767.
        Returns:
        the value as an int
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • readUnsignedBytes

        public int readUnsignedBytes(int[] buffer,
                             int start,
                             int length)
                      throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Reads several bytes received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets each as an unsigned byte, i.e., each value is in the range 0 - 255.
        Parameters:
        buffer - an array to store the read bytes
        start - offset into buffer
        length - the maximum bytes to read
        Returns:
        the number of bytes received
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • readUnsignedWord

        public int readUnsignedWord()
                     throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Reads 2 bytes received from the iRobot over the serial connection and interprets them as an unsigned word, i.e., value is in range 0 - 65535.
        Returns:
        the value as an int
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • writeByte

        public void writeByte(int b)
               throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Sends a byte over the serial connection to the iRobot.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte sent
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] bytes,
                       int start,
                       int length)
                throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Sends several bytes over the serial connection to the iRobot
        Parameters:
        bytes - an array of bytes
        start - the position of first byte to be sent in the array
        length - the number of bytes sent.
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int[] ints,
                       int start,
                       int length)
                throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Sends several bytes over the serial connection to the iRobot
        Parameters:
        ints - an array of ints that are cast to byte before sending
        start - the position of first byte to be sent in the array
        length - the number of bytes sent.
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • writeSignedWord

        public void writeSignedWord(int value)
                     throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Sends a signed word to the iRobot over the serial connection as two bytes, high byte first.
        Parameters:
        value - an int in the range -32768 - 32767.
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • writeUnsignedWord

        public void writeUnsignedWord(int value)
                       throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Sends an unsigned word to the iRobot over the serial connection as two bytes, high byte first.
        Parameters:
        value - an int in the range 0 - 65535.
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

        Closes the serial connection
